docs.snippet: The Latest on the fatal shooting of a black woman in a gunfire exchange with police that also injured a young boy (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Facebook Suspended Account During Standoff
headline.main: The Latest: Facebook Suspended Account During Standoff

docs.snippet: In the midst of a five-hour standoff that turned deadly, Facebook granted an emergency request from the Baltimore County Police Department to take offline the social media accounts belonging to a woman who wielded a shotgun at officers.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Account Deactivated as Woman Posts During Standoff
headline.main: Facebook Account Deactivated as Woman Posts During Standoff

docs.snippet: Facebook employees weren’t directed to squelch conservative news on the site’s Trending Topics, nor would that be easily accomplished by a staff member who wished to do so.

headline.print_headline: At Facebook, Human Backup  for Algorithms Proved Fallible
headline.main: Facebook ‘Trending’ List Skewed by Individual Judgment, Not Institutional Bias

docs.abstract: Current and former Facebook employees, interviewed in connection with accusations company intentionally suppresses conservative news stories, say company's Trending Topics feature began as pilot operation using recent college graduates who were inappropriately given judgment over which news stories to cover; Facebook executives agree that many aspects of company's news curation policies and procedures are wrong and need to be fixed.

docs.snippet: A Florida man is back in jail after clicking "like" on a Facebook photo posted by a witness in a case against him.

headline.print_headline: Facebook 'Like' Gets Florida Man a Return Trip to Jail
headline.main: Facebook 'Like' Gets Florida Man a Return Trip to Jail

docs.snippet: At the F8 Facebook developers conference, the Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg unveiled an update to the Messenger app that will allow people to communicate online orders directly to a business, through a bot.
Popular messaging service WhatsApp said it would start sharing users' phone numbers with parent Facebook Inc, marking a notable shift in its stance on privacy.

headline.print_headline: WhatsApp Relaxes Privacy Stance, to Share Phone Numbers With Facebook
headline.main: WhatsApp Relaxes Privacy Stance, to Share Phone Numbers With Facebook

docs.snippet: Readers discuss claims that the influential website is suppressing conservative views.
Facebook Inc stock has the potential to climb by more than 20 percent over the next year given the growing advertising revenue among its platforms, according to a Barron's report on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Can Climb More Than 20 Percent on Ad Growth: Barron's
headline.main: Facebook Can Climb More Than 20 Percent on Ad Growth: Barron's

docs.snippet: It’s the last chance to prevent a lazy and limited man who lies and cheats and thinks he has “great genes” from demeaning the Oval Office.
Larossi Abballa broadcasted to Facebook Live after killing a police captain and his companion at their home in a suburb of Paris on Monday.
